question: Each of the digits in the number 64197238 is arranged in ascending order from right to left. The position of how many digits will remain unchanged as compared to that in the original number?
solution:
64197238

After arranging above number in ascending order from right to left -

64197238
98764321

No digits will remain unchanged as compared to that in the original number.

question: In a certain code language, 'CROWN' is written as '58', 'GUEST' is written as '46'. How will 'DOUBT' be written in that language?
solution:
In this, the position of all the consonants is added to obtain the resultant.

CROWN ----- 3 + 18 + 23 + 14 = 58

GUEST ----- 7 + 19 + 20 = 46

Similarly,

DOUBT ---- 4 + 2 + 20 = 26

So, option (d) is the correct answer.

II. Some bed are Chair
option_1: Neither conclusion I nor II follows
option_4: Either conclusion I or II follows
solution:

I. Some sofa are table ----- Does not follow

II. Some bed are Chair ----- Follows

So, Only conclusion II follows.

question:
Three statements are given, followed by three conclusions numbered I, II and III. Assuming the statements to be true, even if they seem to beat variance with commonly known facts, decide which of the conclusions logically follow(s) from the statements:

Statements:

All Nail are Pin

All Spikes are Pin

All Pins are Tack

Conclusions:

I. All Nail are Tacks

II. All Spikes are Tack

III. Some Tack are Pin
option_4: All I, II and III follow
solution:
Statements:

All Nail are Pin

All Spikes are Pin

All Pins are Tack

All Nail are Tacks: All Nail are Pin. All Pins are Tack. Thus, All Nail are Tacks. So, conclusion I is true.

All Spikes are Tack: All Spikes are Pin. All Pins are Tack. Thus, All Spikes are Tack. So, conclusion II is true.

Some Tack are Pin: All Pins are Tack. Thus, Some Tack are Pin. So, conclusion III is true.

Hence, All conclusions I, II and III follow.


https://u1.oliveboard.in/exams/solution/oliveimg/p23916/image021.png

question: In a certain code language, 'PAS' is written as '6' and 'ALONG' is written as '7'. How will 'BORN' be written in that language?
solution:
'PAS' is written as '6' and 'ALONG' is written as '7'.

Here, the pattern is:

P+A+S = 16+1+19 = 36 and √36 = 6

A+L+O+N+G = 1+12+15+14+7 = 49 and √49 = 7

Similarly,

B+O+R+N = 2+15+18+14= 49 and √49 = 7

question: Ayushman Bharat PM-JAY provides a health cover of ________ per family per year for secondary and tertiary care hospitalization.
solution:
Ayushman Bharat PM-JAY is the largest health assurance scheme in the world which aims at providing a health cover of Rs. 5 lakhs per family per year for secondary and tertiary care hospitalization to over 12 crores poor and vulnerable families (approximately 55 crore beneficiaries) that form the bottom 40% of the Indian population.

The households included are based on the deprivation and occupational criteria of Socio-Economic Caste Census 2011 (SECC 2011) for rural and urban areas respectively. PM-JAY was earlier known as the National Health Protection Scheme (NHPS) before being rechristened. It subsumed the then existing Rashtriya Swasthya Bima Yojana (RSBY) which had been launched in 2008.

The coverage mentioned under PM-JAY, therefore, also includes families that were covered in RSBY but are not present in the SECC 2011 database.

PM-JAY is fully funded by the Government and cost of implementation is shared between the Central and State Governments.

question: Sama-Chakwa, Karma are dance forms of __________
solution:
Dance forms of Bihar

question: Code of Points is a rule book that outlines the point values of various skills of a:
solution: Gymnasts are judged by the Code of Points, a rule book that outlines the point values of various skills. A gymnast's final score is calculated from a start value, where the gymnast begins with the highest possible score and then has points deducted for elements that may have been lacking in her routine.

question: Who among the following was the Governor of Reserve Bank of India when the LPG reforms were introduced?
solution: India introduced the Liberalization Privatization and Globalization (LPG) reforms in 1991. S Venkitaramanan, a member of the Indian Administrative Service, had served as Finance Secretary and adviser to the Government of Karnataka prior to his appointment as Governor. He served as the governor of RBI from 22-12-1990 to 21-12-1992.

question: Which of the following statements is INCORRECT for Friction?
option_2: Ball bearings are used to reduce friction
option_3: Friction acts on the ball while moving in the air
option_4: The friction force does not act on fluid
solution: The frictional force on an object in a fluid depends on its speed with respect to the fluid. The frictional force also depends on the shape of the object and the nature of the fluid. Friction can produce heat. Ball bearings are used to reduce friction. Friction acts on the ball while moving in the air. Air friction is experienced by the objects moving through the open air. Air friction acts between the object and the air through which it is moving. It is also called drag.

question: Which of the following report is not published by World Economic Forum?
solution: The Global Assessment Report is published biennially by the UN Office for Disaster Risk Reduction (UNDRR), and is the product of the contributions of nations, public and private disaster risk-related science and research, amongst others.

question: Ustad Ghulam Mustafa Khan, who was awarded the Padma Vibhushan in 2018, was an exponent of _______ gharana of the Hindustani Classical Music.
solution: Ustad Ghulam Mustafa Khan was a celebrated Indian classical musician in the Hindustani classical music tradition, belonging to the Rampur-Sahaswan Gharana. He was a receiver of several accolades including the Padma Shri in 1991, followed by Padma Bhushan in 2006 and Padma Vibhushan in 2018.

question: Which of the following five-year plans focused on Growth with Social Justice and Equality?
solution: The Nineth Five Year Plan (1997- 2002) focussed on 'Growth with Social Justice & Equality'. It aimed to depend predominantly on the private sector - Indian as well as foreign (FDI) & State was envisaged to increasingly play the role of facilitator & increasingly involve itself with social sector viz education , health, etc., and infrastructure where private sector participation was likely to be limited. It assigned priority to agriculture & rural development with a view to generate adequate productive employment and eradicate poverty.

question: In October 2023, Union Minister Amit Shah inaugurated India's first liquid nano di-ammonia phosphate (DAP) plant of Indian Farmers fertilizer Cooperative Limited (IFFCO) in which of the following city?
solution:
In October 2023, Union Home Minister Amit Shah inaugurated India's first liquid nano di-ammonia phosphate (DAP) plant of Indian Farmers Fertiliser Cooperative Limited (IFFCO) in Ahmedabad - Kalol highway in Gandhinagar.

· IFFCO's Nano DAP (Liquid) contains 8% of nitrogen and 16% of phosphorus. This can replace a 50 kg bag of traditional DAP is currently priced at Rs.1350 for farmers.

question: In 1820, who found that electric current causes a nearby magnetic needle to move and thus discovered electromagnetism?
solution:
In 1820, a Danish physicist, Hans Christian Oersted, discovered that there was a relationship between electricity and magnetism. By setting up a compass through a wire carrying an electric current, Oersted showed that moving electrons can create a magnetic field.

Benjamin Franklin: While famous for his kite experiment and his work with electricity, Franklin's primary focus was on static electricity. He didn't directly contribute to the discovery of the relationship between electricity and magnetism.

James Clerk Maxwell: Maxwell is best known for developing Maxwell's equations, which unified electricity and magnetism into a single electromagnetic theory. He showed that light is an electromagnetic wave.

Andr-Marie Ampre: Ampre was a French physicist who, inspired by Oersted's discovery, further investigated the relationship between electricity and magnetism. He developed mathematical laws to describe the magnetic forces between electric currents, laying the foundation for the field of electrodynamics.

question: Under unfavorable conditions many zooplankton species in lakes and ponds are known to enter diapause. This response to abiotic factors is an example of____________.
solution:
Suspend: In bacteria, fungi, and lower plants, various kinds of thick-walled spores are formed which help them to survive unfavourable conditions - these germinate on the availability of a suitable environment.

In higher plants, seeds and some other vegetative reproductive structures serve as means to tide over periods of stress besides helping in dispersal - they germinate to form new plants under favourable moisture and temperature conditions. They do so by reducing their metabolic activity and going into a state of 'dormancy'.

In animals, the organism, if unable to migrate, might avoid the stress by escaping in time. The familiar case of bears going into hibernation during winter is an example of escape in time. Some snails and fish go into aestivation to avoid summer-related problems-heat and dessication. Under unfavourable conditions, many zooplankton species in lakes and ponds are known to enter diapause, a stage of suspended development.

question: Who was the first Indian representative in the modern Olympics?
solution:
India started its maiden Olympic stint with Norman Pritchard at the 1900 Paris Olympics. The first Indian representative in the modern Olympics won the country's first-ever medal (pre-independence) in the men's 200m hurdles.

Norman Pritchard set a then Olympic record 26.8 seconds in the semi-finals. In the final, USA's Alvin Kraenzlein ran a new Olympic record of 25.4 seconds to win the gold while Norman Pritchard won silver with a timing of 26 seconds.

Norman Pritchard earned a second Olympic medal, winning silver in the men's 200m sprint at Paris 1900.

He finished second in the semi-finals to qualify for the final, where Walter Tewksbury of the USA won gold, clocking 22.2 seconds. Norman Pritchard came home in second place to take silver in 22.8 seconds.

Inner CoreExtremely dense, it's made mostly of iron and nickel.

question: Which of the following is the UN Decade of Ocean Science for Sustainable Development?
solution:
The United Nations UN Decade of Ocean Science for Sustainable Development runs from 2021 to 2030.

The UN's vision is "the science we need for the ocean we want", with success closely aligned to achieving the UN Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs) by 2030.

question: India's maiden mission to Venus is scheduled for launch in ______.
solution:
India's maiden mission to Venus, which is scheduled for launch in March 2028, will embark on a 112-day journey to reach the planet.

The Rs.1,236-crore Venus Orbiter Mission (VOM) was approved by the Union Cabinet and the Indian Space Research Organisation (ISRO) on October 1, 2024 revealed the targeted launch window for the mission.

question: By mid-July, which of the following monsoon engulfs the entire Indian subcontinent?
solution: The southwest monsoon sets in over the Kerala coast by 1st June and moves swiftly to reach Mumbai and Kolkata between 10th and 13th June. By mid-July, southwest monsoon engulfs the entire Indian subcontinent.

question: Chandragupta Maurya established Mauryan Empire (322 B.C.) by defeating ____.
solution:
· Chandragupta Maurya was the founder of the Mauryan Empire.

· He, at the young age of 25, captured Pataliputra from the last ruler of the Nanda dynasty, Dhanananda.

· In this task he was assisted by Kautilya, who was also known as Chanakya or Vishnugupta.

question: C Rajagopalachari led the Salt Satyagraha in which of the following states?
solution:
· C Rajagopalachari led the Salt Satyagraha protest in Tamil Nadu.

· He led the salt march from Tiruchi to Vedaranyam against the draconian salt law.

· Rajaji began his march from Tiruchi on April 13 and reached Vedaranyam on April 28, 1930.

· To help Rajaji break the salt law without attracting any surveillance, Sardar Vedarathinam deputed his men to smuggle Rajaji to Agasthyampalli.

question: The Supreme Court of India has the power of judicial review, which means it can declare laws and executive actions unconstitutional. This power is derived from __________ of the Indian Constitution. The High Courts in the states also have the power of judicial review under ____________.
solution:
Article 137 of the Indian Constitution deals with the review of judgments or orders by the Supreme Court. Essentially, it grants the Supreme Court the power to review any judgment or order it has previously pronounced. However, this power is subject to any laws made by Parliament or rules framed under Article 145.

Article 226:

Notwithstanding anything in article 32, every High Court shall have power, throughout the territories in relation to which it exercises jurisdiction, to issue to any person or authority, including in appropriate cases, any Government, within those territories' directions, orders or writs, including [writs in the nature of habeas corpus, mandamus, prohibition, quo warranto and certiorari, or any of them, for the enforcement of any of the rights conferred by Part III and for any other purpose.]

question: Which of the following the name of the sport where a bull is let loose among a crowd and people participating in the sport are supposed to take control of the bull by holding on to its hump for as long as they can?
solution: Jallikattu' event also known as 'Eru Thazhuvuthal' and 'Mancuvirattu' started in full swing in three villages of Tamil Nadu's Madurai. Jallikattu, practised in Tamil Nadu as a part of Pongal celebrations on the day of Mattu Pongal, is a sport where a bull is let loose among a crowd and people participating in the sport are supposed to take control of the bull by holding on to its hump for as long as they can.

question: Which of the following mountain range is not part of Europe?
solution:
Atlas Mountains is a series of mountain ranges in northwestern Africa, running generally southwest to northeast to form the geologic backbone of the countries of the Maghrib (the western region of the Arab world) - Morocco, Algeria, and Tunisia.

Some of the mountains and mountain ranges in Europe are Mount Elbrus, Alps, Caucasus, Black Forest, Mont Blanc, the Apennine, the Pyrenees etc.

question: Which of the following group is also called alkali metals?
solution:
Group 1A is also known as the alkali metals. Although most metals tend to be very hard, these metals are actually soft and can be easily cut.

Group 2A is also called the alkaline earth metals.

Group 7A (or 17) elements are also called halogens.

The noble gases are in group 8A.

question: In the southern ranges of which hills is Mawsynram, which receives the highest rainfall in the world, located?
solution:
Mawsynram, the place that receives the highest rainfall in the world, is located in the Khasi hills of Meghalaya, India.

It receives an average of 11,872 millimeters (467.4 in) of rainfall annually.

The Servarayan hills, with the anglicised name Shevaroy Hills, are a towering mountain range (1620 m) near the city of Salem, in Tamil Nadu state, southern India.

question:
Find the values of p, q and r, so as to satisfy the equations given below:

p + q + r = 12, p - q - r = 8, p - q + r = 20
solution:
p + q + r = 12, p - q - r = 8, p - q + r = 20

Only option 'a' satisfies the equation p + q + r = 12. i.e.

10 + (-4) + 6 = 12

p - q - r = 10 - (-4) - 6 = 8

p - q + r = 10 - (-4) + 6 = 20

Hence, option 'a' is correct.

question: Weights (kg) of 8 students in eight different classes numbered 1 to 8 serially are 30, 40, p, 45, 48, q, 56, 60 respectively. Average of the values obtained from the multiplication of the weight of a student by his class number (for example, class number is 2 if he studies in class 2) is 230. Find the average of 'p' and '2q'.
solution:
Average of the values obtained from the multiplication of the weight of the student by class number is 230

[(1 * 30) + (2 * 40) + (3 * p) + (4 * 45) + (5 * 48) + (6 * q) + (7 * 56) + (8 * 60)]/8 = 230

30 + 80 + 3p + 180 + 240 + 6q + 392 + 480 = 1840

3p + 6q = 438

p + 2q = 146

Required average = (p + 2q)/2

= 146/2

= 73

question: Find the remainder when (721 + 3) is divided by 6?
solution:
(x+1)n = xn + nC1xn-1........ nC(n-1)x + 1

Except last term, each term is a factor of x,

(7)21 = (6 + 1)21

Every term is divisible by 6 except last, which is 1.

Remainder = 1 + 3 = 4

question: In a circle chords PN and KL meet at a point M outside the circle. If ∠ KMP = 28° and ∠ PNL = 110°, then find ∠ KPN.
solution:
∠ KMP = 28° and ∠ PNL = 110°

So ∠ MNL = 180 - 110 = 70°

In Δ MNL,

∠ NLK is an external angle. So ∠ NLK = 70 + 28 = 98°

Since PKLN is a cyclic quadrilateral,

So, ∠ KPN = 180 - ∠ NLK = 180 - 98 = 82°

question: Ticket for an adult and a child is Rs. 1200 and 880 respectively. One child goes free with two adults. If a group has 18 adults and 9 children, what percent of discount does the group get?
solution:
Cost of tickets for 18 adults = Rs. 21600

Cost of tickets for 9 children = Rs. 7920

Total cost of ticket = Rs. 29520

Discount = Rs. 7920

Hence, the discount % = 7920 * 100/29520

= 26.82 %

question: If tan Ө + cot Ө = 12, then what is the value of tan2 Ө + cot2 Ө?
solution:
Let tan Ө = X

cot Ө = 1/tan Ө = 1/X

X + 1/X = 12

=> X2 + 1/X2 = 122 - 2 = 142

question:
From the table given below, find the respective ratio of number of items having price more than Rs.120 to the number of items having price less than Rs.80.
Price (in rupees)40-6060-8080-100100-120120-140140-160
Number of items45352080136104
solution:
Here, number of items having price more than Rs.120 = 136 + 104 = 240

And, number of items having price less than Rs.80 = 45 + 35 = 80

Therefore, ratio = 240: 80 = 3: 1

question: Pipe A, B and C can fill a tank in 10 minutes, 6 minutes, and 18 minutes respectively. Find the time taken to complete the work if pipes are working alternately for 1 minutes each starting from A.
solution:
Capacity of tank = LCM of 10, 6 and 18 = 90 units

Efficiency of pipe A = 90/10 = 9 units

Efficiency of pipe B = 90/6 = 15 units

Efficiency of pipe C = 90/18 = 5 units

Part of work got completed in 3 minutes = (9 + 15 + 5) unit = 29 unit

Part of work got completed in 9 minutes = 29 * 3 = 87 unit

Time taken to complete remaining work = (90 - 87)/9 = 3/9 = 1/3 minutes or 20 seconds

Total time = 9 minutes 20 seconds

question: The price of an article got decreased by 10% each year. If it was purchased 3 years ago, at Rs. X and its current value is Rs. 24786. Find the value of X.

Below bar graph shows the number of male candidates who participated in five competitions from two cities:

Below bar graph shows the percentage of female candidates out of total no. of candidates who participated in five competitions from two cities

Find the average of number of candidates who participated in competition F and competition H from both cities together.


https://u1.oliveboard.in/exams/solution/oliveimg/other/er221020s14072-001.png
https://u1.oliveboard.in/exams/solution/oliveimg/other/er221020s14072-002.png
solution:
The number of candidates who participated in competition F from both cities together = 300 * 100/(100 - 40) + 960 * 100/(100 - 36) = 2000

The number of candidates who participated in competition H from both cities together = 720 * 100/(100 - 20) + 600 * 100/(100 - 50) = 2100

So, required average = (2000 + 2100)/2 = 2050

question: The simple interest on a certain sum of money will be Rs. 1250 after 10 years. If the principal amount is increased to four times after five years, what will be the total interest at the end of 10 years?
solution:
S.I = P * R * T/100

1250 = P * R * 10/100

PR = 12500 .. (i)

10 years S. I = Rs. 1250

5 years S. I = 1250/2 = Rs. 625

Principal = 4P

S.I (Remaining 5 years) = 4P * R * 5/100

= PR/5

Put the value of (i)

= 12500/5

= Rs. 2500

Hence, the required S.I. = 625 + 2500 = Rs. 3125

question:
In the given figure, ∆ABC is an inscribed triangle as shown and DE is a tangent to the circle at C. If ∠ACD = 58° and ∠ACB = 38°, find the value of ∠BAC.


https://u1.oliveboard.in/exams/solution/oliveimg/p26815/image016.png
solution:
∠BCE + ∠ACB + ∠DCA = 180°

∠BCE + 58° + 38° = 180°

∠BCE = 84°

∠BAC = ∠BCE [Alternate segment theorem]

So, ∠BAC = 84°

question:
Directions: The following table shows the marked price of five different articles and percentage discount offered on these in a shop during a festive sale.
ArticleMarked price (in Rs.)Discount%
A84010
B70015
C54020
D7205
E60012

The total selling price of article A and B is Rs. X more than that of article D and E. What is the value of
X_________10
?
solution:
Selling price of article, A = 840 * 90/100 = Rs. 756

Selling price of article B = 700 * 85/100 = Rs. 595

Selling price of article D = 720 * 95/100 = Rs. 684

Selling price of article E = 600 * 88/100 = Rs. 528

Therefore,

X = (756 + 595) - (684 + 528) = 1351 - 1212 = 139

Required answer = (X/10) = 139/10 = Rs. 13.9

question: Time taken by a boat to travel 117 km in upstream is 90 minutes. If the speed of stream is 6 km/h, then find the speed of boat in still water.
solution:
Let the speed of boat in still water(in km/hr) = m

117/(m - 6) = 90/60

m - 6 = 78

m = 84 km/h

Hence, the speed of boat in still water = 84 km/h

question: In a ΔABC, BA is produced to D. Bisector of ∠BDC meet BC at point E such that DE ⊥ BC. DE = 4√33 cm, CE = 16 cm and AD = 17 cm, then AB = __.
solution:
According to the question:

Here, bisector of ∠BDC meet BC at point E such that DE ⊥ BC. This means ∠BED and ∠CED are right angles.

BD = CD and BE = CE = 16 cm

DE = 4√33 cm

By using Pythagoras theorem in ΔBED, we have:

BD2 = BE2 + DE2

BD2 = (16)2 + (4√33)2

BD2 = 784

BD = 28 cm

Now, BD = AB + AD

28 = AB + 17

AB = 11 cm


https://u1.oliveboard.in/exams/solution/oliveimg/p14530/image002.jpg

question: The number of ₹2 coins is 4 times as many as the number of ₹5 coins and 3 times as many as the number of ₹1 coins. If the total value of all the coins is ₹2580, then what is the difference between the number of ₹1 and ₹5 coins?
solution:
Let the number of ₹2 coins = 12x

Number of ₹5 coins = 12x/4 = 3x

Number of ₹1 coins = 12x/3 = 4x

Total value of all the coins = ₹2580

2*12x + 5*3x + 1*4x = 2580

43x = 2580

x = 60

Difference between the number of ₹1 and ₹5 coins = 4x - 3x = x = 60

question: A dishonest shopkeeper professes to sell his goods at the cost price but uses a false weight of 720 g instead of 1 kg. If he bought the goods at Rs. 200, then find his gain percentage.
Height of a cylinder is 1/7th of the radius of cylinder. What is the total surface area if sum of radius and height is 24 cm? (use π = 22/7)
solution:
Let the radius of cylinder = x cm

Height of cylinder = x/7 cm

According to question,

x + x/7 = 24

8x = 24 * 7

x = 21 cm (Radius)

Height = 21/7 = 3 cm

Total surface area of cylinder = 2 πr(h + r) = 2 * 22/7 * 21(21 + 3)

=> 3168 cm2

"

question: Three types of wooden sticks of length 150 cm, 180 cm and 120 cm respectively are joined together to form three large sticks such that length of each large stick is equal and only sticks of similar length are used to form large stick, then find the maximum number of small sticks used to form large sticks.
solution:
Since number of small sticks are minimum. So, length of each large stick should be as large as possible.

Maximum possible length of each large stick = LCM of 150, 180 and 120

= 1800 cm

Length of each large stick = 1800 cm

Total sticks of 150 cm length needed = 1800/150 = 12

Total sticks of 180 cm length needed = 1800/180 = 10

Total sticks of 120 cm length needed = 1800/120 = 15

Required number o sticks = 12 + 10 + 15

= 37

Directions: Study the following graph and answer accordingly. The following graph shows the number of employees recruited (in thousand) in three banks SBI, ICICI and HDFC over the years from 2002 to 2007.

What is the approximate average number of employees in SBI over all the years together?

If 2√5 sin θ = 2, then find the value of
cotθ + 2√5cosθ_________2√5 sinθ - tanθ

Select the option that expresses the given sentence in indirect speech.

John said, "I have been studying for the exam all week and I feel prepared."
option_1: John said that he had been studying for the exam all week and he feels prepared.
option_2: John said that he has been studying for the exam all week and he feels prepared.
option_3: John said that he was studying for the exam all week and he felt prepared.
option_4: John said that he had been studying for the exam all week and he felt prepared.
solution:
Option (d) is the correct answer.

The sentence in the Direct Speech is in Present Perfect Continuous Tense. Therefore, the sentence in the Indirect Speech should be in Past Perfect Continuous Tense.

Present Perfect Continuous (Subject + has/have + been + V1 + ing + Object) should be converted into Past Perfect Continuous (Subject + had + been + V1 + ing + Object).

For example:

He said, "We have been waiting for hours." (Direct Speech)

He said that they had been waiting for hours. (Indirect Speech)

The following things in the sentence should change when changed from Direct speech to Indirect Speech:

· Inverted commas ("..") are removed and 'that' is placed before the reporting speech.

· The pronoun 'I' is changed into 'he'.

· The verbs 'have been studying' is changed into 'had been studying', and 'feel prepared' (simple present tense) is changed into 'felt prepared' (simple past tense).

Therefore, the correct answer is option (d): John said that he had been studying for the exam all week and he felt prepared.

question:
Select the most appropriate synonym of the given word.

Cogent
solution: 'Cogent' means '(Adj)(of an argument or case) clear, logical, and convincing'. Options a) and b) can be rejected as they are unrelated to the word. 'Vague' means 'Of uncertain, indefinite, or unclear character or meaning'. Hence, option c) can also be rejected as it is the exact opposite. 'Erudite' means 'Having or showing great knowledge or learning'. 'Quixotic' means 'Extremely idealistic; unrealistic and impractical'. Hence, option d) is the correct answer.

question:
Select the sentence that has a spelling error.

A. In the heart of the dense forest, a sirene lake sparkled.

B. Animals from far and wide gathered to sip from its sweet waters.

C. Beneath the surface, fish swam gracefully, their presence a sign of the lake's vitality.

D. For countless cycles, this oasis remained a cherished refuge in the wilderness.
option_1: Animals from far and wide gathered to sip from its sweet waters.
option_2: For countless cycles, this oasis remained a cherished refuge in the wilderness.
option_3: In the heart of the dense forest, a sirene lake sparkled.
option_4: Beneath the surface, fish swam gracefully, their presence a sign of the lake's vitality.
solution: The sentence A has a spelling error. The word 'sirene' is spelt incorrectly. The correct spelling of the word is "serene". "Serene" describes a peaceful and calm atmosphere. There is no spelling error in other sentences. Hence, (c) is the correct answer.

question:
Select the most appropriate ANTONYM of the given word from the sentence.

Incipient

After years of ageing in the oak barrels, the wine exhibited a matured flavour profile with hints of oak, fruit, and spice.
solution:
The word "incipient" means in the early stages of development or just beginning to emerge. 'Matured' means fully developed or grown; having reached a desired level of development, ripeness, or complexity, especially over time. So, the two words can be used as antonyms of each other. Hence, (c) is the correct answer.

Exhibited: To display or show something clearly or prominently; to present something for others to see or observe.

Hints: Subtle suggestions or indications of something; small clues or traces that suggest the presence or nature of something else.

Flavour: The distinctive taste or combination of tastes perceived in food or drink, often resulting from various factors such as ingredients, preparation methods, or ageing processes.

question:
Select the most appropriate synonym of the word given in brackets to fill in the blank.

This brought us to the final step of our _______ (pursuit) to find the movement signatures.
solution:
Pursuit: the act of following or searching for someone or something, in order to catch or attack the person or thing.

Quest: a search or pursuit made in order to find or obtain something.

Both words are similar in meaning. Hence, option (c) is the answer.

Appearance: the way a person or thing looks or seems to other people.

Growth: the process of increasing in size.

Definition: a statement of the meaning of a word or word group or a sign or symbol.

question:
Select the option that can be used as a one-word substitute for the given group of words.

Subject to sudden and unpredictable changes of mood or mind
solution:
Astute - having or showing an ability to accurately assess situations or people and turn this to one's advantage.

Balmy - characterized by pleasantly warm weather.

Tyrannical - exercising power in a cruel or arbitrary way.

Mercurial - subject to sudden or unpredictable changes of mood or mind.

Hence, option d) is the answer.

question:
Select the option that will improve the underlined part of the given sentence.

The regulator had taken prompt action regarding the issues and would taken further steps to avoid similar issues in the future.
solution: The underlined phrase in the sentence and the phrase in options (a) & (c) cannot be used in the sentence as they make the sentence grammatically incorrect; the modal verbs 'will' and 'would' take a verb in its base form after them; 'taken' [V3] and 'taking' [V4] are not the base forms of verb. The correct phrase to be used in the sentence is 'would take further' ['further' means 'to a greater extent'], as it makes the sentence grammatically correct and meaningful. 'Farther' which means 'a greater distance from something' is contextually irrelevant. Hence, option (b) is the correct answer.

question:
Directions:

Directions [Set of 5 Questions]: In the following passage, some words have been deleted. Read the passage carefully and select the most appropriate option to fill in each blank.

I was always sceptical of the ___(1)___, "You can probably count your true friends on one hand." That blunt sum felt impossibly restrictive to someone who prides herself on having formed and maintained many meaningful friendships. And then last year, my world became ___(2)___ smaller. Everyone does it in various unexpected ways. Last year wasn't only a period of self-isolating, social distancing, and seeing less of our loved ones; it also ___(3)___ in a number of ended friendships. It's taken me nearly six months to fully confront, but I lost a best friend last year. She was a daily presence in my life. She was the first person I called when a terrible tumble with my bike left me bloody and limping - and she was there by my side before the blood had dried. It was the kind of friendship that felt too ___(4)___ and solid to fail. And then, inexplicably, our few in-person interactions during the summer turned strained and awkward, and neither of us wanted to address the uneasiness. In retrospect, I was trudging through a brief, depressive funk at the time, and I resented her for not asking if I was okay. For all I know, she may have been ___(5)___ in her troubles induced by the annus horribilis - I didn't ask her either.



Which word will perfectly fit the blank labelled as (1)?
solution:
The correct answer is b) Adage.

Key points:

· Adage: a proverb or short statement expressing a general truth.

· This is in context to the author being sceptical of the proverb which states that we can probably count our true friends on one hand.

· Therefore, the correct answer is: Adage.

Additional Information:
WordMeaning
Allurethe quality of being powerfully and mysteriously attractive or fascinating
Allaymake peace or appease
Astutehaving or showing shrewdness and an ability to notice and understand things clearly

question: Select the correct sentence in active voice from the following options.
option_1: The dog chased the playful squirrel eagerly.
option_2: The playful squirrel was being chased eagerly by the dog.
option_3: The playful squirrel is being chased eagerly by the dog.
option_4: He said, "The playful squirrel will be chased eagerly by the dog".
solution:
Option (a) is in the active voice. It states "The dog chased the playful squirrel eagerly," with the subject (the dog) performing the action (chased) directly on the object (the playful squirrel). Hence, (a) is the correct answer.

Options (b) and (c) are in passive voice, focusing on what's happening to the squirrel rather than who's doing the chasing.

Option (d) is the construction of a direct speech sentence.

question:
Sentences of a paragraph are given below in jumbled order. Arrange the sentences in the correct order to form a meaningful and coherent paragraph.

A) By fostering a healthy media consumption habit, children can enjoy cartoons without compromising their overall development and well-being.

B) Cartoon addiction in kids can lead to reduced attention spans and diminished interest in physical activities or social interactions.

C) Parents and educators must balance screen time with other engaging activities to ensure holistic growth.

D) Excessive screen time often impacts their academic performance and hinders the development of critical thinking skills.
solution:
If the sentences are read carefully, it can be noted that the central theme of the passage is mentioned in sentence B. So, it has to be the first sentence in the order. It should be followed by sentence D in which the impact of cartoon addiction is stated which acts as the continuation of the message in sentence B. Sentences C and A make a pair, in which the solution for cartoon addiction, thereby completing the passage appropriately. Therefore, the final order of the sentences is BDCA.

Hence, the correct answer is option (b).

question:
Select the option that can be used as a one-word substitute for the given group of words.

One who hides away on a ship to obtain a free passage.
solution:
'Stowaway' means a person who hides on board a ship, train, etc. so as to get a free passage. Hence, (b) is the correct answer.

'Hairdresser' means one who dresses up women's hair.

'Angler' means one who fishes with a rod.

'Archer' means one who shoots with bows and arrows.

question:
Select the most appropriate meaning of the given idiom.

Laugh all the way to the bank
option_1: The last in a series of unpleasant events that finally makes you feel that you cannot continue to accept a bad situation
option_2: Make a great deal of money very easily
option_3: An apparent misfortune that eventually has good results
solution: The idiom 'Laugh all the way to the bank' means 'Make a great deal of money very easily'. Hence option b) is the correct answer. 'The last or final straw ' means 'The last in a series of unpleasant events that finally makes you feel that you cannot continue to accept a bad situation'. 'Marry money' means 'Marry a rich person'. 'A blessing in disguise' means 'An apparent misfortune that eventually has good results'.

question:
Select the most appropriate synonym to replace the italicised word.

Joe's hapless search for fun led him from one disappointment to another.
solution:
'Hapless' means unfortunate; deserving of pity or sympathy due to experiencing unlucky or adverse circumstances. 'Unlucky' means having or experiencing unfortunate events or outcomes; lacking good fortune. So, the two words can be used as synonyms of each other. Hence, (b) is the correct answer.

Constant: Occurring continuously or persistently; unchanging.

Fruitful: Producing good or useful results; productive or successful.

Tireless: Showing great effort or perseverance; not easily exhausted or fatigued.

question:
The following sentence has been split into three segments. Identify the segment that contains an error. If the sentence is free of any errors, mark 'No error' as your answer.

The wall's sheets, adorned with vibrant/ wallpaper, contribute to the overall aesthetic of the/ room, enhancing its ambience and style.
option_1: the wall's sheets, adorned with vibrant
option_2: wallpaper, contribute to the overall aesthetic of the
option_3: room, enhancing its ambience and style
solution:
The term "the wall's sheets" is not appropriate. The apostrophe is not used in the case of non-living things. The correction involves removing the apostrophe from "wall's" and simply writing 'the sheets of the wall' instead. Hence, (a) is the correct answer.

The corrected sentence would be: The sheets of the wall, adorned with vibrant wallpaper, contribute to the overall aesthetic of the room, enhancing its ambience and style.

question:
Spot the erroneous part if any, in the following sentence.

Sneha greeted (A)/ her neighbours/ very nice (B)/ when they moved/ in next door (C). / No error (D).
solution:
The erroneous part in the sentence is (B). The error in segment (B) is related to the misuse of adjectives and adverbs. In the sentence, "Sneha greeted her neighbours" is the main clause, and "very nice" is intended to describe how she greeted them. However, "nice" is an adjective, which modifies nouns, while "nicely" is the adverbial form of "nice," which modifies verbs. Since we are describing the action of greeting (the verb), we need an adverb, not an adjective. Therefore, to correctly modify the verb "greeted," the adverb "nicely" should be used instead of the adjective "nice." Hence, (c) is the correct answer.

The correct sentence is: "Sneha greeted her neighbours very nicely when they moved in next door."

NOTE:

Adverbs: Words that describe a verb, an adjective, another adverb, or even a sentence as a whole are called Adverbs.

An adjective is a word that modifies a noun or a pronoun. 'Adorable', 'attractive', 'beautiful', 'cruel', and 'clever' are some examples of adjectives.

question:
The following sentence has been split into three segments. Identify the segment that contains an error. If the sentence is free of any errors, mark 'No error' as your answer.

The students found the math/ exam incredible hard, requiring them/ to apply complex problem-solving skills.
solution:
The correct word is "incredibly" instead of "incredible." The adjective "hard" is correct, but it should be preceded by "incredibly" to indicate the degree of difficulty. An adverb (and not the adjective) is used to modify an adjective. Hence, (b) is the correct answer.

The corrected sentence: The students found the math exam incredibly hard, requiring them to apply complex problem-solving skills.

question:
Select the sentence that uses the given idiom correctly.

Bite off more than you can chew
option_1: She bit off more than she could chew when she decided to run a marathon without any training.
option_2: The manager always bites off more than he can chew when he orders food at a restaurant.
option_3: I like to bite off more than I can chew when I study for exams because it motivates me to work harder.
option_4: They bit off more than they could chew when they refused to buy the house for which they couldn't afford the mortgage.
solution:
The idiom "bite off more than you can chew" means to take on a task that is too difficult or demanding for one's abilities or resources. It usually has a negative connotation. Option (a) uses the idiom correctly, as it implies that she took on a challenge that was beyond her capacity and likely failed or suffered. The other options either use the idiom in a positive or neutral way or in a literal sense, which is not appropriate.

Hence, option (a) is the correct answer.

question:
Select the most appropriate synonym of the underlined word.

The mountain path was considered hazardous due to the steep cliffs and unpredictable weather.
solution: The most appropriate synonym for 'hazardous' is 'perilous'. 'Hazardous' means risky or dangerous. 'Perilous' means full of danger or risk. 'Ignoble' means not honourable in character or purpose. 'Indolent' means lazy or avoiding activity. 'Inert' means lacking the ability or strength to move. Hence, (a) is the correct answer.

question:
Select the most appropriate ANTONYM of the given word from the sentence.

Exalt

It is not appropriate to belittle someone's achievements, as everyone's efforts should be acknowledged and respected.
solution:
The word "exalt" means to praise or glorify someone or something highly; to elevate in status or rank. 'Belittle' means to make someone or something seem less impressive or important; to speak or treat someone with disrespect or scorn, often in order to diminish their achievements or worth. So, the two words can be used as antonyms of each other. Hence, (b) is the correct answer.

Appropriate: Suitable or proper in the circumstances; fitting or acceptable according to social norms or standards.

Efforts: The exertion of physical or mental energy towards achieving a particular goal or result; the actions or endeavours made towards accomplishing something.

Respected: Regarded with admiration or esteem; held in high regard by others due to their qualities, achievements, or actions.

question:
Select the most appropriate homonym of the underlined word to fill in the blank.

The guests were allowed to enjoy the party. But they were asked not to speak _____ during the formal dinner.
solution: The most appropriate homonym of the underlined word to fill in the blank is 'aloud'. The sentence implies that the guests were requested not to speak loudly or in a manner that might disrupt the formal dinner. 'Aloud' means to speak audibly or loudly. Other words do not fit the context of the sentence. 'Allude' means to refer to something indirectly or hint at something without explicitly mentioning it. 'Elude' means to evade or escape from someone or something. 'Abound' means to exist in large numbers or to be plentiful. Hence, (a) is the correct answer.

question:
Select the most appropriate option to fill in the blank.

There isn't much time, so I'll just give you the ______ details.
solution:
The given sentence talks about the details that the subject 'I' would provide to the second person 'you'. We need an adjective here that modifies the noun 'details'.

Among the given options, 'bare' fits in the blank appropriately. It is an adjective that means 'only the most basic or important'.

Options a) [noun/verb], c) [noun] and d) [verb] are incorrect as they are not adjectives.

The correct sentence is: There isn't much time, so I'll just give you the bare details.

Hence, (b) is the correct answer.
